newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian wool indicator rises 1c to 626c/kg.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian wool indicator rises 1c to 626c/kg.

text.p: The Australian wool market eastern indicator rose one cent to 626 cents a kg clean on Thursday at sales in Sydney and Geelong, Wool International said.
Merino fleece was mixed, with 19/24 microns 0.5 percent cheaper, 20m slightly dearer, 21m one percent dearer, 22m 0.5 percent dearer, 23m unchanged, and 25/26m slightly cheaper.
Merino skirtings were up to one percent dearer, it said.
In crossbreds, 27m was unchanged, 28m slightly dearer, 29m 0.5 percent dearer, and 30/31m slightly cheaper.
In cardings, lambs were unchanged, with locks one percent dearer and crutchings slightly dearer.
WI said Japanese interests, China and Western Europe were principal buyers with good support from most sectors.
Of the 20,977 bales offered, 7.2 percent were passed in.
Sales continue next week in Sydney, Melbourne and Fremantle with about 118,000 bales to be offered.
